member.summary: Event raised when the property has changed.

member.summary: Occurs when the drop-down is closed.

member.summary: Occurs when the drop-down is opened.

member.name: E:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.DateValidationError
member.summary: Occurs when text entered into the C1DatePicker cannot be parsed or the Date is not valid to be selected.

member.name: E:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.SelectionCommitted
member.summary: The SelectionCommitted event is fired when the selected date is committed.
member.remarks: It's possible, that SelectedDate property is changed while end-user works with drop-down calendar using keyboard. In such case SelectedDateChanged event might be fired many times. SelectionCommitted event is fired only once at closing drop-down calendar. When SelectedDate property is changed without using drop-down calendar, SelectionCommitted and SelectedDateChanged events are fired one by one.

member.name: E:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.SelectedDateChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the property is changed.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.BlackoutDates
member.summary: Gets a collection of dates that are marked as not selectable.
member.value: A collection of dates that cannot be selected. The default value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.DisplayDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date to display in drop-down calendar.
member.exception: The specified date is not in the range defined by and .

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.DisplayDateEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the last date to be displayed.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.DisplayDateStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the first date to be displayed.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.SelectedDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected date.
member.exception: The specified date is not in the range defined by and , or the specified date is in the collection.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.AllowNull
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user can enter null values.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.CalendarStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style that is used when rendering the calendar.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.CaretBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the blinking cursor of an input control. When .NET Framework is v3.5, 'CaretBrush' takes no effect.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.CornerRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the degree to which the corners of the element are rounded.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.CustomFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom date/time format string.
member.remarks:
The default is null.
If you use both Mask and CustomFormat properties, make sure that property values conform to each other.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.FirstDayOfWeek
member.summary: Gets or sets the day that is considered the beginning of the week.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.IsDropDownOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the drop-down calendar is open or closed.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that determines if the is read-only.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.IsTodayHighlighted
member.summary: Gets or sets the boolean value, specifying whether the current date is highlighted in the drop-down calendar.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the input mask.

remarks.para: The mask consists of a string that determines what class of character is acceptable at each input position.
Other characters are treated as literals. They are displayed in the control but cannot be edited.
For example, the mask "000-0000" causes the control to accept only digits at every position except the third, which always contains a dash.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.Prompt
member.summary: Gets or sets the character used to show spaces where user is supposed to type.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DatePicker.SelectedDateFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format that is used to display the selected date.
member.remarks: If specified format is not valid, the is thrown.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text that is displayed by the control.

member.summary: Gets or sets the of the blinking cursor of an input control. When .NET Framework is v3.5, 'CaretBrush' takes no effect.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the degree to which the corners of the element are rounded.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1TimeEditor.CustomFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom date/time format string.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1TimeEditor.CycleChangesOnBoundaries
member.summary: Determines the C1TimeEditor behavior at changing its value by up/down buttons or arrow keys when Value property is equal to Minimum or Maximum property value. The default is true.
member.remarks: By default, if C1TimeEditor.Value property reaches C1TimeEditor.Maximum property value, the next click on Up button will cause changing C1TimeEditor.Value property to C1TimeEditor.Minimum property value. If CycleChangesOnBoundaries property value is false and C1TimeEditor.Value property equals to C1TimeEditor.Maximum property value, all clicks on Up button will be ignored. The same behavior is true for the Down button and Minimum property.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1TimeEditor.Delay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay for the Increase and Decrease buttons.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1TimeEditor.Format
member.summary: Specifies the TimeSpan format the control displays.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1TimeEditor.HandleUpDownKeys
member.summary: Gets or sets If the control handles the Up / Down / PageUp / PageDown keys.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1TimeEditor.Increment
member.summary: Gets or sets the increment applied when the user pressed the up/down arrow keys.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1TimeEditor.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the time, in milliseconds, between repetitions of the click action, as soon as repeating starts, applied to the Increase and Decrease buttons.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1TimeEditor.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that determines if the is read-only.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1TimeEditor.Mask
member.summary: Gets or sets the input mask.

remarks.para: The mask consists of a string that determines what class of character is acceptable at each input position.
Other characters are treated as literals. They are displayed in the control but cannot be edited.
For example, the mask "000-0000" causes the control to accept only digits at every position except the third, which always contains a dash.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value allowed for the .

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum DateTime allowed for the .

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DateTimePicker.CaretBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the blinking cursor of an input control.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DateTimePicker.IsDropDownOpen
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the drop-down calendar is open or closed.

member.name: E:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DateTimePicker.SelectionCommitted
member.summary: The SelectionCommitted event is fired when the new DateTime property value is committed.
member.remarks: It's possible, that DateTime property is changed while end-user works with drop-down calendar using keyboard. In such case DateTimeChanged event might be fired many times. SelectionCommitted event is fired only once at closing drop-down calendar. When DateTime property is changed without using drop-down calendar, SelectionCommitted and DateTimeChanged events are fired one by one.

member.name: E:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DateTimePicker.DateValidationError
member.summary: Occurs when text entered into the DatePicker cannot be parsed or the Date is not valid to be selected.

member.summary: Fires when the property changes.

member.name: P:C1.WPF.DateTimeEditors.C1DateTimePicker.TimeFormat
member.summary: Specifies the C1TimeEditorFormat format that is used to display the selected time.
member.remarks: The C1TimeEditorFormat.TimeSpan value is not valid for this property. If you set TimeFormat property to C1TimeEditorFormat.TimeSpan value, the C1DateTimePicker control will use the previously set value.
